brief.brief: The Service Manager Database Manager is a multi-user, database management system with network-like links.
The DBMS is efficient because it uses a balanced, compressed B-tree, and key and data compression for efficient use of storage. It can hold an unlimited number of fields, records, and tables.

Tables and fields are form-independent and Forms Designer automatically generates their specifications with default data validation. Full data validation and security capabilities are available in the Database Dictionary utility.
Table and record locking functions occur automatically with a database access command.
You can specify data relationships with either traditional, relational joins or user-defined links.

detail.detail: The Database Manager utility supports the following single and multiple record functions:
There is no practical limit to the number of records that you can add or access using the Database Manager.

For record retrieval, Database Manager uses either the Query-By-Example (QBE) method, or the Standard Query Language (SQL) method, whichever is more efficient. It selects the method at the time of the query.

The Database Manager provides three major groups of option keys. Each group is available depending upon the level of processing the user has. Service Manager displays the first group of options on the initial form. These options support single record maintenance or address the table as a single entity.
Service Manager displays the second group of options when it displays a specific record after the user entered a search argument at the initial form. These options manipulate single records.
Service Manager displays the third group of option if it retrieves more than one record. These options perform mass functions on all records in the search list.
